```{r lecture}
library(rethinking)
data("Howell1")
d <- Howell1
precis(d)


sample_mu <- rnorm( 1e4 , 178 , 20 ) 
sample_sigma <- runif( 1e4 , 0 , 50 )
prior_h <- rnorm( 1e4 , sample_mu , sample_sigma )
dens( prior_h )


#### grid approximation #####
d2 <- d[ d$age >= 18 , ]
mu.list <- seq( from=153.5, to=155 , length.out=150 ) 
sigma.list <- seq( from=7 , to=8.5 , length.out=150 )
post <- expand.grid( mu=mu.list , sigma=sigma.list )
#calculate the log-likelihood
post$LL <- sapply( 1:nrow(post) , function(i) sum( dnorm(
  d2$height,
  mean=post$mu[i] ,
  sd=post$sigma[i] ,
  log=TRUE) ) )
#add up the log-likelihood
post$prod <- post$LL +
  dnorm( post$mu , 178 , 20 , TRUE ) +
  dunif( post$sigma , 0 , 50 , TRUE ) # the priors
post$prob <- exp(( post$prod - max(post$prod)))

# visualize
#contour_xyz( post$mu , post$sigma , post$prob)
image_xyz( post$mu , post$sigma , post$prob )


sample.rows <- sample( 1:nrow(post) , size=1e4 , replace=TRUE ,
prob=post$prob )
sample.mu <- post$mu[ sample.rows ]
sample.sigma <- post$sigma[ sample.rows ]

plot( sample.mu , sample.sigma , cex=0.5 , pch=16 , col=col.alpha(rangi2,0.1) )
dens( sample.mu )
dens( sample.sigma )


########### Quardratic approximation ###########
flist <- alist(
height ~ dnorm( mu , sigma ) ,
mu ~ dnorm( 178 , 20 ) ,
sigma ~ dunif( 0 , 50 )
)
m4.1 <- quap( flist , data=d2)

post <- extract.samples( m4.1 , n=1e4 )
head(post)
dens(post$mu)

############# linear regression ############
# define the average weight, x-bar
xbar <- mean(d2$weight)
# fit model
m4.3 <- quap(
alist(
height ~ dnorm( mu , sigma ) ,
mu <- a + b*( weight - xbar ) ,
# the priors of the parameters
a ~ dnorm( 178 , 20 ) ,
b ~ dlnorm( 0 , 1 ) ,
sigma ~ dunif( 0 , 50 )
) ,
data=d2 )

precis(m4.3)

plot( height ~ weight , data=d2 , col=rangi2 )
post <- extract.samples( m4.3 )
a_map <- mean(post$a)
b_map <- mean(post$b)
curve( a_map + b_map*(x - xbar) , add=TRUE )

ggplot(post, aes(a, b) ) +
  geom_bin2d(bins = 70) +
  theme_bw()
```
